column15: PIANOo, the Dutch Public Procurement Expertise Centre
column20: NO: no third party provider encountered
column23:
The data can regularly only be accessed via the website. Only registered users can make selections, save individual offerings or export selections as csv. As far as I can tell, this csv export is not intended as a 'select all' function. The site is also featured on the website opendatanederland.org, which features it as open data. However, the link to the 'dataset' is just to the search site, the data format is marked as 'text' (1)

(1) http://opendatanederland.org/nl/dataset/aankondigingen-van-overheidsopdrachten

column15: Land Information New Zealand (LINZ)
column18:
Data by LINZ is used in numerous contexts. LINZ has a bit ambiguous terms regarding its data. A big CC logo is at the very top of the regarding page (1), yet the very first sentence states "Crown copyright (c)". The following 
paragraph states that all content produced by LINZ, unless otherwise specified, is licensed under CC BY 3.0 NZ.

In general, a map chooser directs users through the proper map section selection (2)

(1) http://www.linz.govt.nz/about-linz/about-this-website/crown-copyright-and-disclaimer
(2) http://www.linz.govt.nz/topography/topo-maps/map-chooser
column21: http://www.linz.govt.nz/topography/topo-maps/map-chooser/christchurch/christchurch (example for a topographic map of a part of Christchurch, in 50 K resolution)
column24: The data is also available in a 250 K.
column26: On the one hand, the data portal by LINZ offers very handy possibilities to select datasets such as "NZ Street Address (Electoral)" - yet, I'd have several 100 datasets to select, and what poses a serious issue is the download size limit of 3.5 GB, which one quickly reaches with high-resolution geodata.
column27: The specific dataset for a section may be downloaded free of charge. However, when big datasets (> 3.5 GB) are selected, the only way to achieve them is having them delivered by courier. Between NZ$ 40 and 85, depending on the country.
column28: https://data.linz.govt.nz/terms-of-use/ - costs only appear when clicking on "Download or Order" in the top right corner.

column26:
Format: txt (ANSI + Linux encoded) - essentially SQL format, making up to 40 GB uncompressed.
The data only can be accessed after registration and paying for the costs of dissemination (NZ$ 54.18)
It consists of several subsets: Roads & Addresses; Parcels; Parcel Topology; Survey Dataset; Marks, Nodes & Coordinates; Survey Observations; Adjustments; System / Shared; Title; Title Memorial
It is updated on a monthly basis.

column24: Comprehensive table with 16 different pages, covering: Overseas merchandise trade, actual values; Overseas merchandise trade, seasonally adjusted and trend values – monthly; Exports by destination; Imports by country of origin; Exports of main commodities; Imports of main commodities; Imports by broad economic category (BEC) group; Exchange rates; Related series, livestock, cars, and crude oil; Exports and imports by Standard International Trade Classification (SITC); Exports by top 10 HS categories, values – seasonally adjusted; Exports by top 10 HS categories, quantities – seasonally adjusted; Imports by selected HS categories, values – seasonally adjusted; Exports by top 10 HS categories, values – trend; Exports by top 10 HS categories, quantities – trend; Imports by selected HS categories, values – trend

column15:
Nigeria has some efforts to establish a Federal Land Information System, but it is not clear how developed this is. 

The Federal Ministry of Lands, Housing & Urban Development has responsibility for this area (1), (2). 

There is evidence that in Nigeria there is Federal Land Information System where land ownership is captured and recorded into a single database (3). However, research found suggestions from senior officials the the program was not fully funded.

(1): http://www.nigeria.gov.ng/2012-10-29-11-06-51/executive-branch/113-federal-ministry-of-lands-housing-and-urban-development/185-federal-ministry-of-lands-housing-and-urban-development

column15:
Ministry of Health
National Population Commission
National Bureau of Statistic
column18:
The Ministry of Health is responsible for this data but it is not available on the website. However, the Ministry of Health has provided information to the National Bureau of Statistics that publishes the health performance information through the Annual Abstract of statistics. The information on health includes The data covers key health indicators, including number of health establishments, ownership, reported cases and deaths from notifiable diseases, and health personnel. Other data include breastfeeding, crude birth rate, crude death rate, and percentage of children less than 1 year not immunized and Type of Immunization received, percentage of women currently using 
family planning and Type of Family planning used, reported malaria cases and deaths from malaria, malaria severe aeneamia and Pregnancy, Birth weight at birth, Type of Birth attendant, and knowledge of contraceptive methods by women.
column23: pdf formats

column15:
Ministry of Education

National Bureau of Statistics
column18: The National Bureau of Statistics has information on examination performances and Students enrollments in both primary and secondary schools. The Ministry of Education provides this information to the National Bureau of Statistics that is published via the Annual Statistical Abstracts.
column19:
Minimal education performance data is on the Bureau of Statistics Website such as at http://www.nigerianstat.gov.ng/nbslibrary/social-economic-statistics/sector-statistics

A small number of education statistics also appear to be published in the NigeriaStat platform, but these are very poorly documented: http://nigeria.prognoz.com/en/DataAnalysis
column20:

Detailed information on performance is usually released as press release by the respective examination agencies.

The free part of the service is limited to an online map interface allowing one to find basic information about properties - http://www.seeiendom.no/.

eg.

column26: Whilst data downloads can only be accessed through a query interface, an API is being introduced with data provided under the Norwegian License for Open Government Data ( NLOD)
column27:
There's two parts to the answer:
- Principally the data on the site may be used as one desires as long as there's attribution to Statistics Norway. The licensing text is a bit less clear than a CC license, but it's here : http://www.ssb.no/en/informasjon/copyright
- The data that's available by the Beta API is available via a Norwegian License for Open Government Data, which is CC 3.0 BA compatible - the link to the license is here data.norge.no/nlod/en/1.0 - and the Beta API information is here : http://data.ssb.no/api/?lang=en

column15:
The Lovdata Foundation. 

Lovdata is a private foundation established in 1981 by the Justice Department and the Faculty of Law in Oslo. The Foundation's purpose is to create, maintain and operate systems for legal information. The Foundation may also contribute to research and development in the Foundation's purpose.

column18:
The basic products managed by the survey include map sheets on scale 1:50,000 and 1:250,000. The agency is charged with the responsibility to survey, print and publish topographical maps of cis-frontier terrain of Pakistan on scale 1:50,000 and derived maps on scales 1:250,000 and 1:1,000,000 for general public use and the defence forces of Pakistan. 

Only a 1:1.5M map is available for download (http://www.surveyofpakistan.gov.pk/downloads/pakphysical.pdf) with other products available through physical contact points.
column20: Open Street Map and other sources have limited data for some major areas of Pakistan http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/WikiProject_Pakistan

column15:
Each province has its own patwari (land ownership) system and are therefore responsible to maintain the data at provincial level rather than central. This information is not available openly and is privy to the provincial government only. However, KPK (1)(3), Sindh (4) and Punjab (2) governments are working to automate this process and make information available online.

##Sources
1. http://www.pehchantv.com/video/index/14051
2. http://www.nation.com.pk/lahore/03-Aug-2013/no-patwari-system-after-2014-shahbaz
3. http://www.unhabitat.org.pk/Digitization%20Land%20Records%20of%20Revenue.html
4. http://sindhlarmis.gos.pk/
column18:
Punjab Provincial Government - http://www.punjab-zameen.gov.pk/

column23: No, the government data is only searchable via SECP website mentioned above. However, from 3rd party like Opencorporates it is provided as open data in machine readable format that can be downloaded.

column15:

Senate of Pakistan - http://www.senate.gov.pk/
column18: All laws and legislations are passed by National Assembly and Senate of Pakistan and are listed/published on their respective websites as well as in printed form.
column20: It is available but not as open data.
column23: The data available is in PDF format which is a scanned copy of the printed order/legislation/rule/resolution by the government.

column15: None.
column16:
There is no central body collecting public transportation services data. Each service/company in itself is expected to maintain its own data. For example, Lahore Transport Company (1) manages its own timetable and routes for public buses. Pakistan Railways (2) is also expected to maintain its own timetable. If any organization chooses not to collect or share this information, then there is no compulsion on them to do so.

At the time of testing, Pakrail's website was inaccessible.

##Sources
1. Http://www.ltc.gop.pk
2. http://pakrail.com/
column17: There is no requirement that third parities should share data.

column15:
Ministry of Commerce
Trade Development Authority of Pakistan (TDAP)
State Bank of Pakistan (SBP)
Pakistan Bureau of Statistics (PBS)
column18:
TDAP provides export related data from Pakistan in XLS format as well.  Data provided by SBP and PBS are in PDF format only that can be downloaded individually.

The TDAP data appears in places to be forecasts rather than actual figures, and actual figures with a breakdown by commodity do not appear to be provided after 2010.
column21: http://www.tdap.gov.pk/tdap-statistics.php - TDAP data is machine readable in XLS format, while the others are only in PDF format.
column24: It is easy to read XLS format as it is based on a template model that is repeated each year.
column26: Each file has to be downloaded individually.
column27: Yes, there are no charging policy from TDAP and SBP. PBS provides most of the data free online in PDF format. However, PBS charges for additional data that needs to be provided on CD in machine readable format.
column29: SBP and TDAP data is for informational use only. However, PBS does have its own policy whereby it is for personal use and cannot be shared with anyone or published without their prior consent.
column33: Irregular and depends upon the availability of data and its publication.
column34: The data is provided free of charge by and large and therefore there is no question of sustainability,
column35: Google search works, so does easy navigation from within each website to the data.

column15: Under the devolution plan, each province is now responsible for their own health management, including statistics. Therefore, Ministries of health of each province are responsible. Hence, Punjab, Sindh, Baluchistan, KPK, Kashmir and Gilgit Baltistan are responsible to collect and share health data.
column18: The data that exists on government websites is usually incomplete, not updated in recent times and just a summary. It is for sure never open data or downloadable in XML/XLS or any other format except PDF at most.
column19:
KPK Province Health Data: http://www.healthkp.gov.pk/healthstatistics.asp
Punjab Province Health Data: http://health.punjab.gov.pk/?q=Reports
Azad Kashmir Health Ministry: http://health.ajk.gov.pk/
Other provinces still lack updated websites

UNICEF: http://www.unicef.org/infobycountry/pakistan_pakistan_statistics.html
column23: It is available online from various sources, including basic from government but not downloadable in XLS, CSV or any other machine readable formats.

National Mapping and Resource Information Authority (NAMRIA) (1), an office attached to the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) (2).

(1) http://www.namria.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(2) http://denr.gov.ph Accessed on 2014-10-27
column18:
NAMRIA produces topographic maps, aerial photographs, and satellite images.  1:250000 maps in jpg format are available for download, other maps are available under charging fee. Since 2011, the Government of Philippines also set up a geoportal using 1:250000 Topographical data from NAMRIA as its based map (1). The project was still under development and testing phase in August 2012 (2). The Open Data Portal lists the topographic map as available under a CC-BY license but the link provided does not enable to download the data (3).

##Sources

(1) http://catalog.geoportal.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(2) https://ggim.un.org/2nd%20Session/country%20reports/Country%20Report%20PhilippinesGGIM2012.pdf Accessed on 2014-10-27
(3) http://data.gov.ph/catalogue/dataset/topographic-map-as-background-basemap-1-250-000-for-the-whole-philippines Accessed on 2014-10-27
column20:
The OpenStreetMap version of the country has benefited from the 2013 Haiyan Typhoon response effort (1) but the overall coverage can still be largely improved (1).

##Sources
(1) http://hot.openstreetmap.org/updates/2013-11-17_openstreetmap_response_to_typhoon_haiyan_yolanda Accessed on 2014-1027
column23: Map of the country is available online as part of the geoportal. Map in 1:25000 scales are also available for download on the NAMRIA website but only in jpg format.

column15:
The new Philippines Statistics Authority (PSA)(1), created in 2013, is still under implementation. The PSA encompasses the former National Statistics Coordination Board (2); National Statistics Office (3); Bureau of Agricultural Statistics (4); Bureau of Labor and Employment Statistics (5).

##Sources

(1) https://psa.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(2) http://www.nscb.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(3) http://www.census.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(4) http://www.bas.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(5) http://www.bles.dole.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
column18:
The PSA website provides links to some statistical portal, including CountryStat (1) (food and agricultural information). The National Statistics Office website provides with a list of publications, but many of them, including results from the census and Statistical Yearbooks are not available online (2). The National Statistics Coordination Board provides some tables such as Gross National Income or Population but only a the national level (3). Finally, the national Open Data portal data.gov.ph contains some statistical datasets such as results from a census on poverty and housing (4). However it is worth noted the portal does not contain data on census results. It also links to datasets that are not available to download such as population 2010.

##Sources

(1) http://countrystat.bas.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(2) http://web0.psa.gov.ph/sites/default/files/2014%20PIF.pdf Accessed on 2014-10-27
(3) http://www.nscb.gov.ph/secstat/d_accounts.asp Accessed on 2014-10-27
(4) http://data.gov.ph/catalogue/dataset?q=HOUSING+INDICATORS Accessed on 2014-10-27

column18:
"The Philippines Business Registry (PBR) is a Government-initiated project that facilitates business registration-related transactions by integrating all agencies involved in business registration, such as the Department of Trade and Industry (DTI), Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Cooperative Development Authority (CDA), Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR), Social Security System (SSS), Home Development Mutual Fund (Pag-IBIG), Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth), Local Government Units (LGUs) and other permit/license-issuing agencies" (1).

Regarding availability of data, the PBR-Search enables to search a company and returns business name, location and scope (2). Results can be downloaded as PDF file. The SEC I-Register website enables to check if a company name exists in the registry but do not provide any information on the company itself (3).

##Sources

(1) http://www.business.gov.ph/web/guest Accessed on 2014-10-27

column15:
The land Transportation Office (1) and Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (2) are the main public agencies responsible for transport in the country. The Philippine National Railways (3) and the Light Rail Transit Authority (4) are public operators responsible for railways transport, together with the private Metro Rail Transit Corporation (5).

(2) http://www.ltfrb.gov.ph/#sthash.wUi28vJz.dpbs Accessed on 2014-10-27

(4) http://www.lrta.gov.ph/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
(5) http://dotcmrt3.weebly.com/ Accessed on 2014-10-27
column18:
For the LRT lines, the Light Rail Transit Authority only provides information on start and end of service (1). No information on periodicity of trains per hour, information on next train, position of trains in real time, etc. The Open Data portal provides some statistical information on Light Rail lines such as number of passenger per Month (2). The National train lines are closed since the 2013 Typhoon but the service should be resume by end of 2014 (3).

##Sources

(1) http://www.lrta.gov.ph/train_operating_schedules.php Accessed on 2014-10-27

column18: No open data of crime statistics is available. In an inquiry made on June 13, 2014 with the Philippine National Police Public Information Office of PCSUPT Reuben Theodore Sindac, it was said that one has to formally request the concerned PNP unit for such information indicating the purpose of the request, period to be covered by the statistics, and other pertinent data. Few data is also available from https://www.senate.gov.ph/publications/AAG%202013-05%20-%20Crime%20Statistics.pdf

column18:
There is an Environment and Natural Resources Statistics Information System (ENRSIS) available online but access require registration (1). It was not possible to register and access the website by the time of the research. Also, there is no environmental data available on the national Open Data portal data.gov.ph but the Philippines government has recently committed itself to make environmental data, including data from ENRSIS, more open (2).

column18:
The COMELEC website provides information on all national elections results (1), however there is no data for president and vice-president election. According to a National Democratic Institute 2010 elections report (2): "The law requires that precinct-level election results be posted publicly on COMELEC’s website. However, on election night, the public posting of transmission results stopped after approximately 90 percent of the results had been posted. Thus, no results were publicly released for approximately 7,500 PCOS machines. The data was soon taken down by the COMELEC. Before it was taken down, a group of IT experts created a mirror image of the site (...). This has raised serious concerns among some political contestants and civil society members." 

##Sources

(1) http://www.comelec.gov.ph/?r=Archives/RegularElections/2010NLE/Results Accessed on 2014-10-29
(2) https://www.ndi.org/files/6_Philippines.pdf Accessed on 2014-11-03
(2) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_presidential_election,_2010#COMELEC Accessed on 2014-10-29

column18: The Head Office of Geodesy and Cartography is responsible for the existence and regular updating of the interactive maps of Poland. column18: The data is available online for anyone to read and seems to be up-to-date. Yet, the data is not available for download in anything else than PDF (not a machine-readable format) and is not openly licensed which severely restricts any use one could decide to make out of it.
column23: Each file is available as a PDF. All titles of files are listed as a table on a static webpage.

column15: Legislation content is provided online by Al-Meezan, the Qatari Legal Portal.
column18: Although data seems available in digital form, it does not seem to be up-to-date (no results for 2014 regardless of the query). The licensing of the website is not very clear as the mentions include both “copyright State of Qatar” and “CC-by 3.0 Unported”.
column23: A typical entry: http://www.almeezan.qa/LawPage.aspx?id=2611&language=en The content can either be displayed on a static webpage or downloaded as PDF or DOC.

column15:
The data provider is Mowasalat: "Mowasalat, popularly known as the “The Transport Company” in Qatar, started its activities by providing land transport services and solutions in October 2004. Mowasalat has a broad Mission of being “a regional leader in the provision of integrated ground transport services”."  (http://www.mowasalat.com/en/staticpages/page/4cd943e1-902d-4ad1-b358-80c81fa8890c)

All links accessed 30 May 2014.
column18:
Transport timetables exist online and in digital form but are solely available through non-governmental channels (Mowasalat) and are in no way available as Open Data. The data is neither machine-readable nor freely accessible — as per the Open Definition, — nor regularly updated.
http://eng.mowasalat.com/site/topics/static.asp?cu_no=1&template_id=296&parent_id=147 (accessed 30 May 2014; the website does not seem available at the moment of the technical assessment though)
column20: Mowasalat website was inaccessible at various points when research was attempted.

column15:
Qatar Information Exchange service (1)

(1): http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/qix/subject_area?subject_area=332
column18:
There is some "Foreign Trade" data available through the Qatar Information Exchange service.

The data which can be easily accessed is however enclosed in PDFs and the website where this data is stored is not openly licensed.

http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/QIXPOC/Documents/QIX%20Knowledge%20Base/Publication/Economic%20statistics/Foreign%20Trade%20Statistics
http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/qix/subject_area/Statistics?subject_area=332

A query interface to access data is also provided through http://ftp.qsa.gov.qa:8088/ but only accessible through MS Silverlight
column20:
Does not seem so. Some data seem to be available through the United States Census Bureau (http://www.census.gov/foreign-trade/balance/c5180.html) also but is far from being detailed, usable and openly licensed.

All links accessed 25 June 2014.
column21: http://ftp.qsa.gov.qa:8088/ - accessible through a query interface.
column24:
The data is only accessible through a Microsoft Silverlight query interface which downloads xml data files. The interface provides limited ability to bulk select months or years.

The downloads come with a .xml extension, but turn out to be xls files which can be opened in Excel.
column26: The query interface does not allow multiple selections of months or years to get a complete breakdown of data.
column27: Anyone can access and download the available texts for free.
column29: "© Copyright 2006-2010 Qatar Information Exchange QALM, Doha- Qatar"
column34: The query interface appears to be well updated and populated with historical data. It was available in both 2013 and 2014 at the same URL.
column35: Some browsing is necessary but no major difficulty exists to find the data. The query interface however uses MS Silverlight, and crashed on some attempts to use it.

column15:
The Supreme Council of Health(1) 

(1): http://www.sch.gov.qa/home-en
column18:
The SCH is responsible for addressing the ongoing MERS epidemic and news reports have discussed measures taken by the Council to improve the management of the outbreak. Although officials communicate information to the media (e.g., Doha News report), no data is to be found online.

The Council also has a means to "Find Health Facilities in Qatar". Although the database attempts to cover both public and private health facilities, quite often the website and links are not functioning.

(1): http://www.sch.gov.qa/
(2): Gulf Times, "Qatar steps up vigilance on Mers", 30 Apr 2014 http://www.gulf-times.com/qatar/178/details/390312/qatar-steps-up--vigilance-on-mers
(3): Doha News, "Amid regional surge of MERS, official says no new incidences in Qatar", April 14, 2014  http://dohanews.co/amid-regional-surge-mers-official-says-new-incidences-qatar/
(4): "Find Health Facilities in Qatar" http://www.sch.gov.qa/FARD/En/findInst.jsp?CSRT=1546920195652092872

All links accessed 25 June 2014.
column23:
.html, .pdf 
The SCH provides information on static webpages while the Qatar Information Exchange has PDFs.

column15:
The Supreme Education Council (1)

(1): http://www.sec.gov.qa/
column18:
The Supreme Education Council handles everything that relates to primary and secondary education (higher ed is managed by the Qatar Foundation and Qatar University).
Also, the Qatar Information Exchange website (QIX) provides some statistical information.

The only data available through the Council's website is the list of schools in the country (web-based query).
http://www.sec.gov.qa/En/ServicesCenter/Pages/QatariSchoolsListing.aspx (schools list)

The govt's strategy http://www.sec.gov.qa/En/about/Documents/Stratgy2012E.pdf

The Qatar Information Exchange website provides some reports but all of these are just outdated PDFs (2007-2009). The few additional stats are also outdated (up to 2012 at best). http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/qix/subject_area/Publications?subject_area=199

All links accessed 25 June 2014.
column23: Mostly PDFs. If we consider the QIX website, exports can be made as XLS and CSV though.

column15:
The Ministry of Interior (1) seems to be the agency handling anything security-related in Qatar. There is no data shared on the website and the media occasionally report in somewhat qualitative terms. Thus, evidence suggests data is collected by the Ministry.

(1): http://www.moi.gov.qa/
column18:
http://www.moi.gov.qa/site/english/aboutMoi/index.html
https://eservices.moi.gov.qa/eservices-portal/ (dysfunctional link)

All links accessed 25 June 2014.
column20:
Data does not appear to be available from a third party.

The US Dept of State has a subdivision, the Bureau of Diplomatic Security, which also provides some information: https://www.osac.gov/Pages/ContentReportDetails.aspx?cid=15215

column15:
Qatar Ministry of Environment (1).

(1): http://www.moe.gov.qa/
column18:
The MoE provides full text versions of the country's environmental legislation, news on environment related topics (workshops, details of government campaigns, e.g. whale shark campaign), links to environmental maps produced by the government, etc. The Ministry has also made available an online portal allowing the public to send messages direct to the Minister. The website is regularly updated.

Emissions of pollutants data is not available through the Ministry of Environment. (Such data is defined as “aggregate data about the emission of air pollutants, especially those potentially harmful to human health.”) On the Qatar Info Exchange website, the tabs "Air emissions", "Air pollution" and "Waste" contain no publications. See box below for direct links to these sections.

Additional governmental websites:

(1): Qatar whale shark campaign http://www.qatarwhalesharkproject.com/
(2): Sustainable Qatar: http://www.sustainableqatar.com/
(3): Qatar Information exchange has some statistics: http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/qix/subject_area?subject_area=356 (PDFs with outdated information when reports available)
(4): QEERI (Qatar Environment and Energy Research Institute) News http://www.qeeri.org.qa/news

Also see:

(5): http://www.moe.gov.qa/English/SitePages/Default.aspx
(6): http://www.qeeri.org.qa/home
(7): http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/qix/subject_area?subject_area=356
(8): http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/qix/subject_area/Publications?subject_area=372
(9): http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/qix/subject_area/Publications?subject_area=373
(10): http://www.qix.gov.qa/portal/page/portal/qix/subject_area/Publications?subject_area=393
column20: Does not seem so although third party organisations dealing with environment and sustainable development exist (independent NGOs are limited in Qatar thus there are very few independent environmental organisations operating). E.g.: EcoMENA (http://www.ecomena.org/) is an independent organisation based in Qatar; its website covers environmental issues and topics for the MENA region. Recent articles (http://www.ecomena.org/solid-waste-management-in-qatar/; 16 June 2014 and more generally http://www.ecomena.org//?s=qatar) detail the problem Qatar faces around solid waste management.

column15: N/A
column16: Elections results are nowhere to be found online: there are no elections in the country (hence no election results to be found; Qatar lacks elected Parliament). The first elections were to be held in Qatar in 2013 (http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-15537725). According to FT.com: "Instead of the promised legislative elections that were due this summer, the emir’s answer was a handover to the next generation, which maintains Doha’s image as a nonconformist country, but without taking the risk of a political opening." (http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/595fa8a8-dd9d-11e2-892b-00144feab7de.html#axzz3HO12Kr2t).

column15:
The Central Tender Committee Law in Qatar governs all contracts of public works, services and supplies. The Tender Law applies to all ministries, governmental services and public institutions. Responsible for processing the majority of public sector tenders is the Central Tender Committee of Qatar (1).

(1): http://www.ctc.gov.qa/
column18:
The data exists but unclear in what format. One cannot obtain information on tenders and bids from the dedicated website, but has to pay to obtain the tender terms of references. It is unclear how the information is provided afterwards nor how it is handled internally.

http://www.fedresurs.ru/Companies (takes data from EGRUL)
EGRUL: http://egrul.nalog.ru/

The authoritave resource however remains EGRUL; the below assessment is based on this website.
column23: Only static webpage/company, with limited info.

column15: All federal laws are published at the official newspaper Rossiskaya gazeta (www.rg.ru) and available via its site. All draft laws discussed at the State Duma (and all legislation passed by national parliament) can be found here http://asozd2.duma.gov.ru/. All draft legislation issues by the executive can be found here http://regulation.gov.ru/index.html. Official website of legal information is available here http://pravo.gov.ru/.
column18: Russian laws and various other official documents. For the purpose of this assessment, http://pravo.gov.ru/ is considered only.
column19:
- Rossiskaya gazeta www.rg.ru

- All draft legislation issues by the executive http://regulation.gov.ru/index.html

column23: Information is available through a web-based query. Sometimes, PDFs also exist. Exports as TXT or RTF are also available for documents, but have to be generated on a per-document basis.

column15: All data on rail transportation (timetable, services, etc.) is available at the national Railway Company RZhD – www.rzd.ru. It is updated on a regular basis. Local transportation data depends on many factors but all regions have websites for their public and private bus routes (for example, http://avtovokzal.ots56.ru/, http://www.chitaavtovokzal.ru/, http://www.yarbust.ru/, http://www.mostransavto.ru/, and dozens others). All this data is available directly and free of charge. As it is impossible to survey all these, the assessment is focused on the Railway Company website (http://pass.rzd.ru/main-pass/public/ru).
column18: The RZhD provides the possibility to formulate web-based queries for national and suburban trains, and gives the prices and timetables once the query is processed. To formulate such a query for the suburban trains, one needs a login though.
column19:
All data on rail transportation (timetable, services, etc.) is available at the national Railway Company RZhD – www.rzd.ru. It is updated on a regular basis.

Local transportation data depends on many factors but all regions have websites for their public and private bus routes (for example, http://avtovokzal.ots56.ru/, http://www.chitaavtovokzal.ru/, http://www.yarbust.ru/, http://www.mostransavto.ru/, and dozens others). All this data is available directly and free of charge.
column20: No, there are commercial companies which collect or build transport data and develop applications. Besides, there is a website TuTu (www.tutu.ru) that collects all information on national and local transportation system (airports, suburban trains, railroad). It’s not 100% reliable as the data it generates comes from many sources but quite good and sufficient. Another option is http://rasp.yandex.ru/.
column23: The data exists as a query to a database.

column15: Federal Customs Service; Federal Statistics Office; Ministry of Economic Development
column19:
http://fedstat.ru/indicators/org.do?id=43 For the Customs as a producer of data. Furthermore, it is necessary to enter key words in Russian about export and import operations, it is possible to see open data on many groups of products exported and imported
Also directly on the Customs website: http://www.customs.ru/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=13858&Itemid=2095
column24: No metadata is included. Files do not seem to be the same between FedSTat and the Customs either.
column26: Each file needs to be downloaded individually (on both websites).
column27: Anyone can access and download the available files for free.
column29:
The Customs have a copyright at the bottom of the website; the FedStat website does not carry any copyright/license mention whatsoever, thus the data cannot be considered openly licensed. Yet, Russian legislation does not instate any restriction on data from aforementioned providers; thus, according to the current Russian legislation, there are no legal restrictions on use, reuse or redistribute statistics data and this is true despite the lack of clear copyright mention.

According to Art. 1259 of Russia's Civil Сode, official government documents including laws, other legal texts, judicial decisions, other materials of legislative, administrative and judicial character are not objects of copyright. The documents here are considered of administrative nature, therefore these provisions are applied and the data is considered openly licensed.
column31: 2014 (Jan-Aug 2014 on the Customs website); data stops at 2011 at FedStat
column34: There is no dataset per se, just files published on different websites and/or spread in different categories on the same website without clear link between them. No syncronisation between the different websites exists as illustrated by the fact that on one site data is outdated while it is up-to-date on the other; no metadata is published either. Updates are unclearly explicited. No publicly accessible information was identified regarding means to sustain further data publication.
column35: There is no dataset per se, just files published on different websites and/or spread in different categories on the same website without clear link between them.

Lastly, the datasets list on the Ministry of Education page is clearly identified as "Open Data" and the definition given below implicitly suggests the compliance with the Open Definition. Thus the data on this website is considered openly licensed.

column27: Anyone can access and download the available files for free, on all three websites.
column29:
It is a tricky question to answer as it depends on the website one considers. More specifically:
- Ministry of Interior OD page: indicates that use, reuse and distribution is allowed for both commercial and non-commercial purposes, but "the use of open data must be only for lawful purposes" and when using the data, the person has to "ensure that he does not distort the open data in their use". This is a vaguely worded thus unclear restriction, therefore is considered non-open.
- FedStat and CrimeStat: The Agency for statistics website does not carry any copyright/icense mention whatsoever, thus the data cannot be considered openly licensed. Yet, Russian legislation does not instate any restriction on data from aforementioned providers; thus, according to the current Russian legislation, there are no legal restrictions on use, reuse or redistribute statistics data and this is true despite the lack of clear copyright mention. According to Art. 1259 of Russia's Civil Сode, official government documents including laws, other legal texts, judicial decisions, other materials of legislative, administrative and judicial character are not objects of copyright.

Since two out of the three surveyed websites seem to provide openly licensed data, the indicator is considered 'Yes'.

column29:
It is a tricky question to answer as it depends on the website one considers. More specifically:
- data.gov.ru: indicates that use, reuse and distribution is allowed for both any purpose, anytime, with no territorial limitation, but then goes on indicating that "the use of open data must be only for lawful purposes" and when using the data, the person has to "ensure that he does not distort the open data in their use". This is a vaguely worded thus unclear restriction, therefore is considered non-open.
- FedStat and GKS: The Agency for statistics website does not carry any copyright/license mention whatsoever, thus the data cannot be considered openly licensed. Yet, Russian legislation does not instate any restriction on data from aforementioned providers; thus, according to the current Russian legislation, there are no legal restrictions on use, reuse or redistribute statistics data and this is true despite the lack of clear copyright mention. According to Art. 1259 of Russia's Civil Сode, official government documents including laws, other legal texts, judicial decisions, other materials of legislative, administrative and judicial character are not objects of copyright.

Since two out of the three surveyed websites seem to provide openly licensed data, the indicator is considered 'Yes'.
column30: data.gov.ru has the terms of use on each dataset page.

column34: There is no dataset per se, just files in different formats published on different websites. No syncronisation between them exists, no metadata is published. Updates are unclearly explicited. As data.gov.ru is in alpha, there are chances the situation changes but at this point, no publicly accessible information was identified regarding means to sustain further data publication.
column35: The files in different formats are published on different websites, it is complicated to get the full picture on environment issues in the Russian Federation. Also, oftentimes data is outdated and/or one-off publication, but no syncronisation exists between the different websites.

Rwanda is one of the least developed countries and because of its recent past history the country has started basic infrastructure development, including road networks only in recent years. According to the website: "The geographic information available from the maps includes orthoimagery (geometrically corrected aerial photographs), elevation, geographic names, hydrography, boundaries, transportation, structures, and land cover. There are other types of geographic information that can be added to create specific types of maps in order to serve some special needs of the geospatial community." (http://www.gcs.gov.sa/Products/Topographic-Products.aspx)
column23: No data is available online. The only information available is PNG/JPG images and indications data is available but no actual data was identified.

column15:
According to Al-Tamimi & Co. (the largest non-affiliated law firm in the Middle East), The Realty in Kind Registration Law, issued by Royal Decree No. 6 on 9/21423H, corresponding to 24/2/2004 (RKR Law) has introduced the compulsory registration of land ownership, in two step-process, the first being: "The Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs will prepare cadastral maps of each property in a designated area. The Ministry of Justice will then document the rights relating to each identified property and that information will be placed in the register according to the status quo under the supervision of a competent local court judge."

Given the amount of foreigners willing to buy land and build houses in KSA, changes have been introduced (or are planned, at least): "The Economic Cities Act issued almost two months ago makes KAEC the first place where foreign nationals and companies are allowed to own property in the kingdom, the CEO said. Regulations putting the act into effect will probably be issued within a few months, he said. The new rules will also cover foreclosures, repossessions and the creation of a land registry." (Arabian Business)

Thus, one may assume that the data is collected by the government (theoretically there has to be an ongoing collection) but that it is not shared.

column15: The Central Department of Statistics and Information handles KSA's national statistics. The data is available online, is generally up-to-date and is accessible free of charge. Data is not openly licensed and is in XLS format.

Yet, not all indicators are provided in machine-readable format though, e.g. cost of living information for September 2014 (http://www.cdsi.gov.sa/2010-10-02-08-30-17/441-prim-m-sep2014). Lastly, sometimes data is provided as a narrative on a static webpage (e.g., here: http://www.cdsi.gov.sa/2010-10-02-08-30-17/440-prim-m-sep2014)

column18:
The King is at the top of the legal system. He acts as the final court of appeal and can issue pardons. There are also courts in the Kingdom. The largest are the Shari'a Courts which hear most cases in the Saudi legal system. The King is also advised by a legislative body, the Majlis Al-Shura (Consultative Council). The Shura Council is composed by 150 members all appointed by the King for four-year renewable terms. The Shura has the right to propose new laws and amend existing ones.

Ministry of Justice manages the legislation. Yet it is difficult to find the fulltext versions of KSA's laws.

http://www.saudiembassy.net/about/country-information/laws/ 
http://www.moj.gov.sa/ar-sa/Pages/judgmentsystems.aspx

- http://www.saudi.gov.sa/wps/portal/!ut/p/b1/jY_dToNAEIWfpQ9gZnZZCl4uoPwI2wK7FLhpIBgCbcEo0ZanF69Mmhi8nOT7zjkDJRSEMqKhtjUo5FAO1WfXVlM3DtX55y63R-7aVuozijtDEvR1w9a4TojLKByg8Baq-JtCStZCVnz8n2-73GNGiGiGro4-91TyGGsaxmzND6Bsz2O9_HvwoVho45c21TLAd6y9qSJKTWQgIUd2TPvbmz-f5qTHayjV6To5MaLMdqJ3MiGfhZgaIZ6IIDILI9USIa0wVR9z1NT7JkuUxXkw0Ka-L7yb94JLYRGA8MbLK1zK91vXPdRzPudffLP5Bl2U9xc!/dl4/d5/L2dBISEvZ0FBIS9nQSEh/?catQuery=MCIT%2FOGD%2FOGD%2FOpen%20Government%20Data%2FEducation%20and%20training
- http://www.cdsi.gov.sa/english/index.php?option=com_docman&Itemid=161

Overall: some information available online, but the quality of the data is very bad and datasets are scarce. Most data is out of date by at least 2 years. The available data is of very limited scope so analysis is impossible. No data is available on exam results (neither regional nor national level); no data is available on textbook availability or school resources. Some data is available on budgets, but only at a ministry level for male and female sections.
column26: Each file needs to be downloaded individually.
column29: Copyright by the individual institutions.
column31: 2013 for the CDSI files; 2011 for these available on the e-gov portal.
column34: Files are spread over different websites but are not synchronised, information is not updated on a regular basis, no metadata exists.
column35: One needs to dig into the e-gov portal to identify the "Open Government Data" part before being able to reach the files; the MoE solely authorises inquiries for information (e.g., student grades, https://www.moe.gov.sa/Arabic/EServices/Student/Pages/StudentServices.aspx).

column15:
Financial Intelligence Unit
Committee for the Promotion of Virtue and the Prevention of Vice
Ministry of Interior
column18:
Depends on the type of crime one considers. KSA has low criminality although some researchers have expressed concern that complaints are resolved outside formal judicial institutions and as a consequence remain undocumented by the police.

Thus, for ex., money laundering and illegal cash flows are surveyed by the Financial Intelligence Unit while enforcing traditional Islamic morality in the Kingdom is ensured by the Committee for the Promotion of Virtue and the Prevention of Vice.

https://www.osac.gov/pages/ContentReportDetails.aspx?cid=13573 (a report, no data; accessed 17 June 2014)
http://en.wikiversity.org/wiki/Comparative_law_and_justice/Saudi_Arabia#Criminal_Statistics (a report, no data; accessed 17 June 2014)

column15: The General Presidency for Meteorology and Environmental Protection should be responsible for this data. Website: http://www.pme.gov.sa/env_protect.asp It seems possible to request information from this agency (form here: http://www.pme.gov.sa/NWrequest.asp) but it is unclear a) what type of information they would provide; b) whether one has to pay for it.

Elections in KSA are rare (see list of elections on the Saudi e-gov portal). The Parliament of KSA is the Consultative Assembly (Majles al-Shura), composed by 150 members appointed by the King. 

Municipal elections in Saudi Arabian towns and cities are planned for 2015. Following men-only elections in 2005 and 2011, women will be able to participate in the 2015 election. According to the e-gov portal: "[...] half of the municipal council members are chosen by elections, and the other half of members are appointed by the Minister of Municipal and Rural Affairs in terms of efficiency and eligibility."

Previous municipal elections have seen summary numbers published only (see the Statistics page below). The Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs maintains the Municipal Councils Elections website where results are published.

column18:
The Statistics Institute provides a data portal (1) from where it is possible to select and download series of economic and demographic statistics from 1970 to 2015 (projection). Unfortunately only population data from 2008 to 2015 seems to be available for demographic section. There is also a dedicated website for the general census of the population realized in 2013 (2) but it only contains preliminary and unconsolidated results. Finally the Institute also has an archives portal that lists some important statistics datasets but there only the metadata are available (3). According to the access policy data can only be reused by members of the National Statistics System.

column15:
The Surveys and Lands department (division) from the Ministry of Land, Country Planning and Environment is primarily responsible for the surveying and mapping of all lands (1). In the Western Area, the Office of the Administrator and Registrar General (OARG), a department of the Office of the Attorney General and Minister of Justice, is responsible for the General Registry which registers transaction relating to land such as deeds, leases, mortgages, etc.(2)

##Sources
(1) Public Sector Reform Unit of Sierra Leone, Management and Functional review of the Ministry of Lands, Country Planning, and the Environment, 2010, p24,  http://psru.gov.sl/sites/default/files/sites/default/files/reports/MIN%20OF%20LANDS%20and%20COUNTRY%20PLANNING%202010.pdf Accessed on 2014-09-01
(2) Office of the Administrator and Registrar General, http://www.oarg.gov.sl/Land%20Registry.html Accessed on 2014-09-01
column16:
The Minister of Land, Country Planning and Environment is committed to developing a biometric registration of land to satisfy ownership claim and security of ownership. The Ministry is also in the process of undertaking a geospatial survey in partnership with multilateral companies to identify and demarcate the country’s natural resource capacity for the provision of a development plan (1). "There is currently no system of registration of titles in Sierra Leone. The Registration of Instruments Act, Cap 256 of the Laws of Sierra Leone 1960 created a system of registration of instruments of conveyance. In this system, it is the conveyance itself which confers title, not the registration of the instruments under which the conveyance was executed" (2). Lastly, according to the OARG, the Government is in the process of adopting a new land policy that will make for the introduction of a land title registration system where in it is envisaged that the western area will be a pilot project (3).

##Sources

(1) Alpha Bedoh Kamara, Africa Young Voices (AYV), As Residents and officials Praise Hon. Musa Tarawallie Lands Ministry Changes for the Better, published on  April 7th, 2014 ( http://africayoungvoices.com/2014/04/as-residents-and-officials-praise-hon-musa-tarawallie-lands-ministry-changes-for-the-better/ accessed on 31st May 2014)
(2) DFID Sierra Leone by Shaun Williams assisted by Pamela Oredola-Davies, Freetown (2006), SCOPING STUDY LAND AND PRO-POOR CHANGE IN SIERRA LEONE - http://www.britishcouncil.org/land-and-pro-poor-change-in-sierra-leone.pdf accessed on 29th July 2014
(3) Office of the Administrator and Registrar General, http://www.oarg.gov.sl/Land%20Registry.html Accessed on 2014-09-01

A National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) in Sierra Leone has been developed and published in 2008 for the 2008-2012 period (1). The result was the publication of new reports and indicators, such as the annual Economic Survey Report, during that period. However there is no evidence the publication of these reports will be sustained. The latest census data are available but dates back to 2004 (2).

column15: Department of Environmental Affairs
column18:
The South Africa Air Quality Information System (SAAQIS) was launched in 2010 by the Department of Environmental Affairs (1) and is run by the South Africa Weather Service.

SAAQIS, provides a common platform for managing air quality information in South Africa. It makes data available to stakeholders including the public and provides a mechanism to ensure uniformity in the way air quality data is managed i.e. captured, stored, validated, analysed and reported on in South Africa.

There is also data on the Environment GIS website and it is provided in form of Maps and graphics. It is a GIS inventory of all protected and conservation areas in South Africa. The database, which is currently being developed, will eventually also include data on privately owned protected areas. The database distinguishes between various types and sub-types of protected areas and conservation areas. Protected area types include: National Parks, Nature Reserves, Special Nature Reserves, Mountain Catchment Areas, World Heritage Sites Protected Environments, Forest Nature Reserves, Forest Wilderness Areas, Specially Protected Forest Areas and Marine Protected Areas. 

(1): http://www.gov.za/speeches/view.php?sid=8773
column19: SAQQIS data is not available to download - although request for data can be made through an online form. The website does provide an interactive graphs of some statistics, though these did not appear to function during testing.

column29: INE's license. It forbids to denaturalize the intention of the data, which makes it not open: it goes against any "accessible" principle that data should we made available to the widest range of purposes. It is unclear what original intention the data has, so it is ambiguous to claim that someone "denaturalized" it.

All the information of companies in the country is available through an official bulletin (1) as a supplement of the BOE. This information (organization, financial information, etc.) is usually in PDF and HTML formats but there is also more information in the databases of Commerce Chambers (although this one is not open by default). In conclusion the Spanish Ministry of Industry  and Economy is the agency in charge of publishing corporate information. The information is also provided through the Registro Mercantil Central (Central trade registry)

(2): http://www.rmc.es/ Accessed October 19th, 2014

All the information about legislation is publicly available through the Spanish Official Bulletin (BOE) (1) as PDF or HTML. Furthermore all regions have their own official bulletin so regional legislation (2) (3) or particular implementations of an act are also available in the different regional bulletins. In conclusion, the Spanish government, ministries and regional/local governments are the ones in charge of publishing legislation.

column15: Lantmateriet, National Authority, http://www.lantmateriet.se
column18: Presently, maps still have to be paid for except for one in the resolution 1:1.000.000. As of July 1, 2015, vector overview maps at a higher resolution will be provided as open data. The raster version will be discontinued after this date.
column20: All the higher resolution map data returned by the search of geodata.se included a "Copyright" notice limiting the use to very specific causes. Essentially, the portal aggregates geo information from different sources and the source it directs to for mapping data is Lantmateriet.
column24: The data is not provided before paying, so evaluation only based on tryout datasets provided for the 1:250.000 GSD Overview Map. The files also contain the possibility of downloading in MapInfo format.
column26: It might be available for paying customers, but is not available directly.
column27:
Only a very basic map is available in a 1:1.000.000 resolution. (1)

column29: Depending on the use case - free for students, private use and researchers, paid-for for commercial uses (0,032 Swedish Kroner per square kilometre.)
column31: 2013 for general map, specific information weekly - see below (2014-09-18)
column33:
Weekly - from the 1:250.000 descripton: 
"GSD overview map will be updated continuously with information on public roads, railways, administrative divisions, airports, conservation areas and military areas. The updates are based on collaboration with other government agencies, municipalities, organizations, and some editorial collection. New vector data is available weekly." (1)

(1) http://www.lantmateriet.se/en/Maps-and-geographic-information/Maps/Oversiktskartan/GSD-Oversiktskartan-vektor/
column34: Data is regularly published and updated.
column35: Having a look via geodata.se and being redirected to lantmateriet.se, I decently got to the overview maps.

column15: Lantmateriet, http://www.lantmateriet.se/
column18: Acquiring data besides information referring to own property is not that easy. Generally, one has to pay for such data services. According to Web Index Research, one also can contact a local branch of Lantmateriet for access to information, which you will get if your access is considered legitimate, as e.g. in Stockholm: http://www.stockholm.se/ByggBo/Kartor-och-lantmateri/Lantmateri-fastighetsfragor/Fastighetsinformation/
column24: Property map of entire Sweden. Shapefile and MapInfo formats provided - however they require a login, as a fee applies.
column26: Presumably data is available in bulk and old versions.
column27: Fees charged for commercial use. Essentially, access to property data not related to oneself is charged with a fee.
column29: In contrary to the right to access data (public principle), data in big amount is only available to professionals against a fee and after registration. Also fees for PSI re-use are charged.
column33: presumable daily, but not able to check due to login restriction.
column34: Presumably, after it is maintained for very long.
column35: Not really, as I could not access first hand information, but had to look for info scraps all over different sites.

column15: Statistiska Centralbyran, http://www.scb.se/
column18: SCB offers a pretty good approach to their data, with pre-configured tables/charts (sometimes with source xls download), sometimes direct xls download or interactive tables, which are easy to use. The reason: Easy "select" all functions.
column20: It seems the authority in charge now provide parts of their statistics as open data - but only via API. http://www.scb.se/sv_/Om-SCB/Oppna-data-API/
column22:
(1) xls
(2) csv, tsv, txt, xlsx, json (API)
(3) xls
column24:
(1) Population in the country, counties and municipalities, by sex and age, December 31, 2013 
(2) Jobs and vacancies in the private sector by NUTS2 region, table contents and quarterly (select all in interactive form rather easy) 
(3) Quarterly GDP 1993-2014: including 2nd (publ. 2014-09-18). Corrected 2014-09-24
column26: 2nd example is so vast that I'd consider the data a bulk here; 3rd also allows using the POST API for data download.
column29: Essentially, Attribution
column34: Definitely, published over a long time, frequent updates, also API possibilities which also enables permanent updates in case of corrections.
column35: Going via the CBS website and using the "Find Statistics" function and looking via "Statistics by topics" worked fairly well. Only the GDP (BNP) took some time, as it was under "National Accounts" (Nationalräkenskaper).

column15: Ministry of Finance
column18:
The Ministry of Finance publishes a non-detailed annual state budget (older budgets are available as PDFs in a digital archive).
State authorities generally publish their individual budgets on their respective websites.
column24: Title referring to here: "From the Budget Bill for 2014". The data provided consists in only a few excel pages, far away from a real budget (file size 78 KB). A lot of positions only consist of one or two subpositions.
column26:
No bulk download, and archive only exists with PDFs (1)

(1) http://www.regeringen.se/sb/d/2548/a/55839
column29: No obvious one. Assuming that the data is in the public domain.
column33: Yearly with additional bills in spring and amending budgets in fall.
column34: In its limited scope - yes. However, the level of details does not allow breaking down exact proposals. Basically, the numbers given are not more than an index that would lead to the detailed chapter. The recent years are available as xls, before only as pdfs.
column35: Going via regeringen.se got me there quickly, other sources (OD Index, Google) also pointed me there.

column15: Center for Public Transport - Samtrafiken: http://www.samtrafiken.se/
column18:
Individual transport companies, within each mode of transport, provide online timetables. 
For capital city of Stockholm, the local traffic company provides real-time updates via an API (1), 
Info is also available in GTFS format via the platform trafiklab.se. They rely on data collected by the Public Transport Center Samtrafiken. 

(1) http://xn--ppnadata-m4a.se/dataset/sl-realtids-api
column24:
From the description: 
"With this API, you can download files with scheduled public transport in Sweden. The information published by API from Samtrafiken in Sweden AB. Interconnection is responsible for gathering information about scheduled public transport (timetables) for all public transport carried out in Sweden. This is collected in a common traffic system called GTI. The contract is governed by a directive from the Transport Agency and is a consequence of the law that took effect in early 2012 for public transport in Sweden.
column26: Essentially the normal download can be considered as bulk
column27: Free, but login required for downloading GFTS data. For more calls than 50 per month a higher API level is required.
column29: The license is aligned to CC-BY.
column33:
Between once per day and once per week. See (1) for a quick check.

(1) https://api.trafiklab.se/samtrafiken/gtfs/feed_info.txt
column34: The GFTS dataset of trafiklab.se is only downloadable after creating a login and an API key thereafter. They have a nice call for the up-to-dateness of the GTFS dataset, which doesn't require an API key.
column35: Yes, fairly easy via http://xn--ppnadata-m4a.se/dataset?groups=transport and OD Index.

column15:

(Kommerskollegium / The National Board of Trade - http://www.kommers.se/)
column18: The National Board of Trade provides a number of statistics compiled from different sources. However, the data is only available as PDF or via an interactive tool, which also doesn't allow any other downloads but PDF either. Most importantly, the main data source is the Statistical Office.
column24:
(1) Imports and exports of goods. Total values ​​by trading partners, adjusted for non-response. Years 1998 - 2013
(2) Imports and exports by trading partner and commodity groups SITC rev3 / rev4, not adjusted loss, privacy gutted. Years 1995 - 2013

Data can be downloaded fairly easily in just a few selection steps of the interactive tables. However, the prefab tables given under b) don't allow downloading as machine-readable, only one of all the tables and charts proviedd.
column26:
If one considers the time series go back until 1995 (2) or even 1975 (1) and can be selected, should be bulk.
Also, an API for downloading SCB data with open terms exists (3)

column15: Brottsforebyggande Radet (Brå; = National Council for Crime Prevention ) - http://www.bra.se/
column18: Bra is an agency under the Ministry of Justice. It mainly works on reducing crime and improving safety levels and also produces the country's official crime statistics. The available statistical data is divided into preliminary and final, and can be accessed down to to municipal level. Also, time rows ranging back 50 years or more on an aggregated level are available.

Direction fédérale des mensurations cadastrales, Office fédéral de topographie swisstopo (1) is responsible for the provision of cadastral data at federal level.

##Sources
(1) http://www.cadastre.ch/internet/cadastre/fr/home.html Accessed on 2014-10-01
column18:
There is no land registry at national (federal) level only at states level. However there is the development of a Web Map Service for Land registry (WMS-MO), a project which involve the provision of data of the cadastral survey (data MO) via a WMS (Web Map Service). This is a project of the e-geo "Geoservices Cantons" under the guidance of the Conference of Cantonal geoinformation Switzerland (CCGEO) and conducted in collaboration with the Conference of Cantonal Cadastre (CSCC) (1). It is also already possible to access available parcels boundaries via a Cadastral Web Map (2), however related land registry data will be only available trough the WMS-MO restricted service.  There is also an ongoing project eGris (3) that will provide an electronic real estate information system (eGRIS) for the country by end of 2014. 

##Sources
(1) http://www.cadastre.ch/internet/cadastre/fr/home/products/webmap/wms.html Accessed on 2014-10-01
(2) http://www.cadastre.ch/internet/cadastre/fr/home/products/webmap/cwm.html Accessed on 2014-10-01
(3) Roadmap E-Government Switzerland, November 19th 2013, http://www.egovernment.ch/umsetzung/00852/index.html?lang=en Accessed on 2014-10-01

column18:
Swiss-Impex is the database of Swiss foreign trade statistics. The application allows access to the monthly statistical data on Swiss imports and exports from 1988 onwards according to the following domains: tariff number, nature of goods, broad economic category, SITC and trading partner. The requests are limited to 10000 cells result for basic version. The expert version contains the domains canton, mode of transport, customs revenue and indices in addition to the domains contained in the basic version. This version allows for major requests and offers numerous other functions (1). The Swiss Federal Statistical Office provides aggregated data in reusable format for imports and exports from 1990 to 2013 (2).

##Sources
(1) http://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/portal/de/index/themen/06/05/blank/data.html Accessed on 2014-10-01
(2) http://www.ezv.admin.ch/themen/04096/05728/index.html?lang=en Accessed on 2014-10-02

column18:
There is no data online on the Ministry of Lands, Housing and Human Settlement Development - http://www.ardhi.go.tz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=200&Itemid=221

The Mapping Section is one of four core sections of SMD. Its major responsibility is map production. The core function of the Mapping Section is the preparation of base maps for urban and rural areas. The main mode of preparation of maps is by analogue methods. Digital mapping is progressively being introduced with the aim of phasing out analogue methods which are inefficient and inflexible to changes and cannot fully meet the ever changing and more diversified Customer needs. Introduction of digital mapping technology is progressing procuring new equipment/systems hand in hand with training of staff on full utilization of the technology.http://www.ardhi.go.tz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=258&Itemid=333

This data is not shared as open data but as interactive search query of results from the website. http://nec.go.tz/index.php?modules=about&sub&op=b

http://nec.go.tz/index.php?modules=election_results&sub=&etype=1&year=10

Electoral Institute for Sustainable Democracy in Africa http://www.content.eisa.org.za/old-page/tanzania-2010-presidential-election-results
column23: Data is available on the website but it is retrieved through searching.

column15: The Public Procurement Regulatory Authority (PPRA), a government regulatory body.
column18: The agency has got a Tender Portal - http://tender.ppra.go.tz/. The portal has information on current tenders, awarded tenders and those that have been closed.
column20: There is no open data source.
column23: pdf format and also on the website

column15: The Royal Thai Survey Department works under the Ministry of Defense. It is responsible for aerial land survey, map making, geodesy and geophysics. Its website can be found at http://www.rtsd.mi.th/index.php
column18:
The Royal Thai Survey Department offers only hard copy maps. 
Products offered by the Royal Thai Survey Department: <http://www.rtsd.mi.th/MapInformationServiceSystem/>;

column15: The Department of Land is setting up a National Land Database. The Department of Land works under the Ministry of Interior. Its major responsibilities are land registration, cadastral survey, mapping, and land redistribution. The Department of Land’s website can be found at www.dol.go.th/
column18: http://www.dol.go.th

column15: The National Statistical Office works under the Ministry of Information and Communication Technology since 2008. Its duties are to collect, manage and provide national statistics, especially census data. Its website can be found at http://www.nso.go.th/
column26: All files are accessible from the same web page, but these is mainly secondary data, not raw data
column29: No license information, just a global site copyright
column34: Although there are just two census published so far, these are covering the last 15+ years. Also, the publication is supported by the stats agency.
column35: first result in a web search

column15:
The Bureau of the Budget works under the Office of the Prime Minister. Its responsibility involves making budget plan and controlling government spend. Its website can be found at http://www.bb.go.th/bbweb/

The Ministry of Finance Information Center also provide data: http://dwfoc.mof.go.th/foc_eng/menu3.htm
column23: Whilst information on expenditure against the budget framework appears to be available at http://dw.mof.go.th/foc/gfs/a.asp the actual budget in machine readable format is not available.

column15:
The Bureau of the Budget works under the Office of the Prime Minister. Its responsibility involves making budget plan and controlling government spend. Its website can be found at http://www.bb.go.th/bbweb/

The Ministry of Finance also provide data at http://dw.mof.go.th/foc/gfs/c.asp

The Department of Business Development works under the Ministry of Commerce. Its duties involve company registration and business development, including business database development. Its website can be found at http://www.dbd.go.th/main.php?filename=index
column18: Monthly registration listings including name, description, main activity and headquarters
column26: Just for a single year
column29: No license information is available
column34: Data available for the last 5 years
column35: The business register site is easy to find, but the business listings are not easily localizable within the site.

column15: The Office of The Council of State acts as the law consultant of the state.
column18: Palace Laws on Succession; Constitution of the Kingdom of Thailand; Acts and Emergency Decrees; Code of Laws; Revolutionary Council Order; Treaties
column23: html, pdf or tiff

column15: Department of Land Transport is responsible for land transport development and organizing land transport.
column18: National public transport timetables are not on the Land Transport Department website (http://www.dlt.go.th/th/). Public transport information can be found separately on each service provider’s website, though detailed timetables may not be available.
column23: only html and/or pdf

column15: The Department of Foreign Trade works under the Ministry of Finance. Its major responsibilities are to create and maintain benefits from foreign trade opportunities. Its website can be found at http://www.dft.go.th/Default.aspx?tabid=101
column18: Monthly international trade statistics and details on specific products
column23: pdf only

column15: The Bureau of Policy and Strategy of the Ministry of Public Health develop policies and strategies for the ministry. It is also responsible of developing a public information system regarding public health and cooperate with private and international sectors.
column18: General health statistics, diseases and infrastructures
column23: pdf

column15: Ministry of Education
column18: Different subdivisions of Ministry of Education provide statistics on number of students, teachers, school, etc, but not school attendance rates, nor teacher attendance rates. As for test scores for pupils in national examinations, annual summary of national test is provided by The Bureau of Educational Testing.
column24: Download file link at the top and bottom of the page
column29: No license information available
column34: Some historical data is available but most recent years are missing.
column35: The statistics are distributed among several different sites and that makes difficult to get the overall composition

column15: The Office of Justice Affairs, Ministry of Justice, set up the Center of Justice Statistics to collect and analyze data about justice affairs of Thailand in order to improve the justice system of the country.
column29: No license information is available
column34: Mostly outdated. Although historical series are available recent years are usually missing
column35: Requires more advanced (re)search

column15: the Department of Environmental Quality Promotion is responsible for information about environment. It does provide studies on subjects regarding environment (http://www.deqp.go.th/index.php?option=com_phocadownload&view=category&id=2&Itemid=54&lang=th) but not the statistics. The statistics are found in the website of National Statistics Office.
The Election Commision is an independent government agency responsible of arranging regional and national elections.

column15: Thai Government Procurement Office

column15: Ministry of Defense (National Army, topographic department)
column18: Not available. OpenStreetMap has data which is used by the Ministry of Interior (http://interieur.gov.tn/fr/catalog/delegations-par-gouvernorats-de-la-republique). Yet this map only mentions delegations of the government per governorate (province). No map data per se is available. Nothing about maps is provided on http://www.data.gov.tn/fr/ either.

column15: Conservation de la Propriété Foncière (CPF); website http://www.cpf.gov.tn/cpfsite/index.html
column18: The website of the CPF doesn't include data on land ownership: it just gives a list of the services this office provides and the list of documents needed in each case. One may be able to access some of the registration acts by filing a demand to the CPF (http://www.cpf.gov.tn/cpfsite/Francais/Accueil.asp); the conditions do not say how much it costs nor whether the information will be provided to anyone.

For ex. http://www.ins.nat.tn/demog/emploi/afr/Tableau_1_ar_fr.xls
There are however quite some data available as tables on a static webpage

column27: Anyone can access and download the available files for free.

column31: 2014 first trimester; the other data/info is from 2013, some from earlier
column34: Files, when they exist, are a one-off publication. The updates are unclearly motivated. No publicly accessible information was identified regarding means to sustain further data publication.
column35: Straightforward once the visitor is on the INS website.

column15: Ministry of Economy and Finances; data is available http://www.finances.gov.tn/index.php?option=com_jdownloads&view=viewcategory&catid=1&Itemid=712&lang=fr
column18: Budget for 2014: of the government in general and per Ministry; Citizen Budget for 2014; tentative budget for 2015; etc. Once a year (generally in December) the budget is published in the JORT (Journal Officiel de la Republique Tunisienne; Official Gazette). It can be accessed on the web (PDF) and on paper.
column23: Only PDF information is provided on the Ministry of Finance website. Some outdated information is reported to be available on the country's Open Data portal from 2010, 2011, 2012, but on checking no detailed budget information in machine readable formats could be located: http://www.data.gov.tn/index.php?option=com_mtree&task=listcats&cat_id=2&Itemid=187)

column15: Ministry of Economy and Finances
column18:
Data about spending is partially available online, both through the Ministry of Finances and through the official Open Data Tunisia portal. Thus, data about the 2012 budget execution is available but not in a very detailed way and only through PDFs: http://www.data.gov.tn/fr/index.php?option=com_mtree&task=viewlink&link_id=40&Itemid=187 
Some data about expenditure can also be accessed here: http://www.finances.gov.tn/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=127&Itemid=303&lang=fr

Fully disaggregated data are not available, some is at: http://www.data.gov.tn/index.php?option=com_mtree&task=listcats&cat_id=2&Itemid=187 (for 2012)
Some data about expenditure can also be accessed here: http://www.finances.gov.tn/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=127&Itemid=303&lang=fr (up-to-date)

column15: Agence de Promotion de l'Industrie (API, part of the Ministry of industry, energy and mines)
column18:
An example of entry: http://www.tunisieindustrie.nat.tn/fr/dbi.asp?action=result&ident=2292
The entry provides summary information about the name and the legal status of the company (LLC, etc.) as well as where its market is (only export, export-import, etc.), the type of activity, the name and the address of the founder and the company, the number of jobs it has created (here, 35).

Information is available online, as static webpages per entry, and on paper. The JORT ("Journal officiel de la Republique Tunisienne", Official Gazetta) regularly publishes the list of the companies that are established including the name of the CEO, the assets at the date of creation, the address and the main activities.
column23: Information is available online, as static webpages per entry, and on paper.

column15:
For the Constitution: Assemblée Nationale Constitutive (ANC is the Tunisian Parliament)
For Laws: Presidency of the government
column19:
The JORT ("Journal officiel de la Republique Tunisienne", the Official Gazette) regularly publishes all the laws and official decisions of the government including the constitution. http://www.iort.gov.tn/. However, these are largely in PDF format.

Also, since 2012, recent laws bills are published on the official website of the Constituent Assembly: http://www.anc.tn/site/main/AR/docs/projets/liste_projets.jsp On this website (Arabic-only, French broken), documents are available in PDF formats.
column23: Where available, the texts are released as PDFs. The Official Gazette publishes static webpages, thus one needs to browse its website to identify the laws.

column15:
SNCFT (Société Nationale du Chemin de Fer Tunisien) for railways
SNTRI (Société Nationale de Transport Interurbain) for buses
TRANSTU (Transport Tunis) for buses and tramway in Tunis (the capital)
column18: Web search engine provides information in HTML format. The visitor needs to enter departure and arrival location (for buses), and time and date as well, for trains. Provides routes with pricing.
column19:
http://www.sncft.com.tn/index.php
http://www.sntri.com.tn/html_fr/tarif_horaire_sntri.php
http://www.transtu.tn/horaire/index.php

Web search engine provides information in HTML format.
column20:
Some information about the regional trains and regional buses is also published on the newspaper "La presse".

See also http://www.fahrplancenter.com/Fahrplan_SNCFT.html

At GTFS file for the national rail service is listed at http://www.gtfs-data-exchange.com/agency/societe-nationale-des-chemins-de-fer-tunisiens/ but the provenance of this is uncertain.
column23: Web search engine provides information in HTML format.

.pdf, .doc, .docx, .html
These are the formats under which the data is provided. The only exception seems to be the information on Knoema, yet it is unclear how one can exploit it given the restrictive copyright rules and the lack of clearance from the Ministry about the possibility to upload it there.

column15: Ministry of Education
column18: Number of public education pupils, budgets of schools, locations of schools

No publicly accessible information was identified regarding means to sustain further data publication.
column35: There is no dataset per se, just files in different formats published on different websites. No syncronisation between them exists. One needs to dig in the different websites to find some information.

No publicly accessible information was identified regarding means to sustain further data publication.
